026package org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.util;
027
028import java.io.BufferedReader;
029import java.io.IOException;
030import java.io.InputStream;
031import java.io.InputStreamReader;
032import java.net.HttpURLConnection;
033import java.net.MalformedURLException;
034import java.net.URISyntaxException;
035import java.net.URL;
036import java.net.URLConnection;
037import java.util.HashMap;
038import java.util.Map;
039import java.util.Properties;
040import java.util.TreeMap;
041
042import javax.lang.model.SourceVersion;
043import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
044import javax.lang.model.element.ModuleElement;
045import javax.lang.model.element.PackageElement;
046import javax.tools.Diagnostic;
047import javax.tools.Diagnostic.Kind;
048
049import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.AbstractDoclet;
050import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.BaseConfiguration;
051import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.Resources;
052
053import javax.tools.DocumentationTool;
054
055import jdk.javadoc.doclet.Reporter;
056
057/**
058 * Process and manage "-link" and "-linkoffline" to external packages. The
059 * options "-link" and "-linkoffline" both depend on the fact that Javadoc now
060 * generates "package-list"(lists all the packages which are getting
061 * documented) file in the current or the destination directory, while
062 * generating the documentation.
063 */
064public class Extern {
065
066    /**
067     * Map element names onto Extern Item objects.
068     * Lazily initialized.
069     */
070    private Map<String, Item> moduleItems = new HashMap<>();
071    private Map<String, Map<String, Item>> packageItems = new HashMap<>();
072
073    /**
074     * The global configuration information for this run.
075     */
076    private final BaseConfiguration configuration;
077
078    private final Resources resources;
079
080    private final Utils utils;
081
082    /**
083     * True if we are using -linkoffline and false if -link is used instead.
084     */
085    private boolean linkoffline = false;
086
087    /**
088     * Stores the info for one external doc set
089     */
090    private static class Item {
091
092        /**
093         * Element name, found in the "element-list" file in the {@link #path}.
094         */
095        final String elementName;
096
097        /**
098         * The URL or the directory path at which the element documentation will be
099         * available.
100         */
101        final DocPath path;
102
103        /**
104         * If given path is directory path then true else if it is a URL then false.
105         */
106        final boolean relative;
107
108        /**
109         * Indicates that docs use old-form of anchors.
110         */
111        final boolean useOldFormId;
112
113        /**
114         * Constructor to build a Extern Item object and map it with the element name.
115         * If the same element name is found in the map, then the first mapped
116         * Item object or offline location will be retained.
117         *
118         * @param elementName Element name found in the "element-list" file.
119         * @param path        URL or Directory path from where the "element-list"
120         * file is picked.
121         * @param relative    True if path is URL, false if directory path.
122         */
123        Item(String elementName, DocPath path, boolean relative,
124                boolean useOldFormId) {
125            this.elementName = elementName;
126            this.path = path;
127            this.relative = relative;
128            this.useOldFormId = useOldFormId;
129        }
130
131        /**
132         * String representation of "this" with elementname and the path.
133         */
134        @Override
135        public String toString() {
136            return elementName + (relative ? " -> " : " => ") + path.getPath();
137        }
138    }
139
140    public Extern(BaseConfiguration configuration) {
141        this.configuration = configuration;
142        this.resources = configuration.getDocResources();
143        this.utils = configuration.utils;
144    }
145
146    /**
147     * Determine if a element item is externally documented.
148     *
149     * @param element an Element.
150     * @return true if the element is externally documented
151     */
152    public boolean isExternal(Element element) {
153        if (packageItems.isEmpty()) {
154            return false;
155        }
156        PackageElement pe = utils.containingPackage(element);
157        if (pe.isUnnamed()) {
158            return false;
159        }
160
161        return findElementItem(pe) != null;
162    }
163
164    /**
165     * Determine if a element item is a module or not.
166     *
167     * @param elementName name of the element.
168     * @return true if the element is a module
169     */
170    public boolean isModule(String elementName) {
171        Item elem = moduleItems.get(elementName);
172        return elem != null;
173    }
174
175    /**
176     * Convert a link to be an external link if appropriate.
177     *
178     * @param element The element .
179     * @param relativepath    The relative path.
180     * @param filename    The link to convert.
181     * @return if external return converted link else return null
182     */
183    public DocLink getExternalLink(Element element, DocPath relativepath,
184            String filename) {
185        return getExternalLink(element, relativepath, filename, null);
186    }
187
188    public DocLink getExternalLink(Element element, DocPath relativepath,
189            String filename,
190            String memberName) {
191        Item fnd = findElementItem(element);
192        if (fnd == null)
193            return null;
194
195        // The following is somewhat questionable since we are using DocPath
196        // to contain external URLs!
197        DocPath p
198            = fnd.relative ? relativepath.resolve(fnd.path).resolve(filename)
199                : fnd.path.resolve(filename);
200        return new DocLink(p,
201            fnd.useOldFormId ? getOldFormHtmlName(memberName) : memberName);
202    }
203
204    /**
205     * Build the extern element list from given URL or the directory path,
206     * as specified with the "-link" flag.
207     * Flag error if the "-link" or "-linkoffline" option is already used.
208     *
209     * @param url        URL or Directory path.
210     * @param reporter   The <code>DocErrorReporter</code> used to report errors.
211     * @return true if successful, false otherwise
212     * @throws DocFileIOException if there is a problem reading a element list file
213     */
214    public boolean link(String url, Reporter reporter)
215            throws DocFileIOException {
216        return link(url, url, reporter, false);
217    }
218
219    /**
220     * Build the extern element list from given URL or the directory path,
221     * as specified with the "-linkoffline" flag.
222     * Flag error if the "-link" or "-linkoffline" option is already used.
223     *
224     * @param url        URL or Directory path.
225     * @param elemlisturl This can be another URL for "element-list" or ordinary
226     *                   file.
227     * @param reporter   The <code>DocErrorReporter</code> used to report errors.
228     * @return true if successful, false otherwise
229     * @throws DocFileIOException if there is a problem reading the element list file
230     */
231    public boolean link(String url, String elemlisturl, Reporter reporter)
232            throws DocFileIOException {
233        return link(url, elemlisturl, reporter, true);
234    }
235
236    /**
237     * Check whether links to platform documentation are configured. If not then configure
238     * links using the documentation URL defined in {@code linkPlatformProperties} or the
239     * default documentation URL if that parameter is {@code null}.
240     *
241     * @param linkPlatformProperties path or URL to properties file containing
242     *                               platform documentation URLs, or null
243     * @param reporter the {@code DocErrorReporter} used to report errors
244     */
245    public void checkPlatformLinks(String linkPlatformProperties,
246            Reporter reporter) {
247        PackageElement javaLang
248            = utils.elementUtils.getPackageElement("java.lang");
249        if (utils.isIncluded(javaLang)) {
250            return;
251        }
252        DocLink link = getExternalLink(javaLang, DocPath.empty,
253            DocPaths.PACKAGE_SUMMARY.getPath());
254        if (link != null) {
255            // Links to platform docs are already configure, nothing to do here.
256            return;
257        }
258        try {
259            int versionNumber = getSourceVersionNumber();
260            String docUrl;
261
262            if (linkPlatformProperties != null) {
263                docUrl = getCustomPlatformDocs(versionNumber,
264                    linkPlatformProperties);
265            } else {
266                docUrl = getDefaultPlatformDocs(versionNumber);
267            }
268            if (docUrl == null) {
269                return;
270            }
271            DocPath elementListPath = getPlatformElementList(versionNumber);
272            URL elementListUrl
273                = AbstractDoclet.class.getResource(elementListPath.getPath());
274            if (elementListUrl == null) {
275                reporter.print(Kind.WARNING, resources.getText(
276                    "doclet.Resource_error", elementListPath.getPath()));
277            } else {
278                try (InputStream in = open(elementListUrl)) {
279                    readElementList(in, docUrl, false, versionNumber,
280                        isOldFormPlatformDocs(versionNumber));
281                } catch (IOException exc) {
282                    throw new Fault(resources.getText(
283                        "doclet.Resource_error", elementListPath.getPath()),
284                        exc);
285                }
286            }
287        } catch (Fault f) {
288            reporter.print(Kind.ERROR, f.getMessage());
289        }
290    }
291
292    /**
293     * Checks if platform docs for the specified version use old-form anchors.
294     * Old-form anchors are used by Oracle docs for JDKs 8 and 9.
295     * It can be checked on https://docs.oracle.com/javase/<version>/docs/api
296     *
297     * @param version
298     * @return True if docs use old-form anchors
299     */
300    private boolean isOldFormPlatformDocs(int version) {
301        return 8 == version || 9 == version;
302    }
303
304    /**
305     * Return the resource path for the package or element list for the given {@code version}.
306     * @param version the platform version number
307     * @return the resource path
308     */
309    private DocPath getPlatformElementList(int version) {
310        String filename = version <= 8
311            ? "package-list-" + version + ".txt"
312            : "element-list-" + version + ".txt";
313        return DocPaths.RESOURCES.resolve("releases").resolve(filename);
314    }
315
316    /**
317     * Return the default URL for the platform API documentation for the given {@code version}.
318     * @param version the platform version number
319     * @return the URL as String
320     */
321    private String getDefaultPlatformDocs(int version) {
322        Resources resources = configuration.getDocResources();
323        return version <= 10
324            ? resources.getText("doclet.platform.docs.old", version)
325            : isPrerelease(version)
326                ? resources.getText("doclet.platform.docs.ea", version)
327                : resources.getText("doclet.platform.docs.new", version);
328    }
329
330    /**
331     * Retrieve and return the custom URL for the platform API documentation for the given
332     * {@code version} from the properties file at {@code linkPlatformProperties}.
333     * @param version the platform version number
334     * @param linkPlatformProperties path pointing to a properties file
335     * @return the custom URL as String
336     */
337    private String getCustomPlatformDocs(int version,
338            String linkPlatformProperties) throws Fault {
339        String url;
340        try {
341            Properties props = new Properties();
342            InputStream inputStream;
343            if (isUrl(linkPlatformProperties)) {
344                inputStream = toURL(linkPlatformProperties).openStream();
345            } else {
346                inputStream = DocFile
347                    .createFileForInput(configuration, linkPlatformProperties)
348                    .openInputStream();
349            }
350            try (inputStream) {
351                props.load(inputStream);
352            }
353            url = props.getProperty("doclet.platform.docs." + version);
354        } catch (MalformedURLException exc) {
355            throw new Fault(resources.getText("doclet.MalformedURL",
356                linkPlatformProperties), exc);
357        } catch (IOException exc) {
358            throw new Fault(
359                resources.getText("doclet.URL_error", linkPlatformProperties),
360                exc);
361        } catch (DocFileIOException exc) {
362            throw new Fault(
363                resources.getText("doclet.File_error", linkPlatformProperties),
364                exc);
365        }
366        return url;
367    }
368
369    /**
370     * Return the source version number used in the current execution of javadoc.
371     * @return the source version number
372     */
373    private int getSourceVersionNumber() {
374        SourceVersion sourceVersion = configuration.docEnv.getSourceVersion();
375        // TODO it would be nice if this was provided by SourceVersion
376        String versionNumber = sourceVersion.name().substring(8);
377        assert SourceVersion
378            .valueOf("RELEASE_" + versionNumber) == sourceVersion;
379        return Integer.parseInt(versionNumber);
380    }
381
382    /**
383     * Return true if the given {@code sourceVersion} is the same as the current doclet version
384     * and is a pre-release version.
385     * @param sourceVersion the source version number
386     * @return true if it is a pre-release version
387     */
388    private boolean isPrerelease(int sourceVersion) {
389        Runtime.Version docletVersion = configuration.getDocletVersion();
390        return docletVersion.feature() == sourceVersion
391            && docletVersion.pre().isPresent();
392    }
393
394    /*
395     * Build the extern element list from given URL or the directory path.
396     * Flag error if the "-link" or "-linkoffline" option is already used.
397     *
398     * @param url URL or Directory path.
399     * 
400     * @param elemlisturl This can be another URL for "element-list" or ordinary
401     * file.
402     * 
403     * @param reporter The <code>DocErrorReporter</code> used to report errors.
404     * 
405     * @param linkoffline True if -linkoffline is used and false if -link is
406     * used.
407     * 
408     * @return true if successful, false otherwise
409     * 
410     * @throws DocFileIOException if there is a problem reading the element list
411     * file
412     */
413    private boolean link(String url, String elemlisturl, Reporter reporter,
414            boolean linkoffline)
415            throws DocFileIOException {
416        this.linkoffline = linkoffline;
417        try {
418            url = adjustEndFileSeparator(url);
419            if (isUrl(elemlisturl)) {
420                readElementListFromURL(url,
421                    toURL(adjustEndFileSeparator(elemlisturl)));
422            } else {
423                readElementListFromFile(url,
424                    DocFile.createFileForInput(configuration, elemlisturl));
425            }
426            return true;
427        } catch (Fault f) {
428            reporter.print(Diagnostic.Kind.ERROR, f.getMessage());
429            return false;
430        }
431    }
432
433    private static class Fault extends Exception {
434        private static final long serialVersionUID = 0;
435
436        Fault(String msg, Exception cause) {
437            super(msg + (cause == null ? "" : " (" + cause + ")"), cause);
438        }
439    }
440
441    /**
442     * Get the Extern Item object associated with this element name.
443     *
444     * @param element Element
445     */
446    private Item findElementItem(Element element) {
447        Item item = null;
448        if (element instanceof ModuleElement me) {
449            item = moduleItems.get(utils.getModuleName(me));
450        } else if (element instanceof PackageElement pkg) {
451            ModuleElement moduleElement = utils.containingModule(pkg);
452            Map<String, Item> pkgMap
453                = packageItems.get(utils.getModuleName(moduleElement));
454            item = (pkgMap != null) ? pkgMap.get(utils.getPackageName(pkg))
455                : null;
456        }
457        return item;
458    }
459
460    /**
461     * If the URL or Directory path is missing end file separator, add that.
462     */
463    private String adjustEndFileSeparator(String url) {
464        return url.endsWith("/") ? url : url + '/';
465    }
466
467    /**
468     * Fetch the URL and read the "element-list" file.
469     *
470     * @param urlpath        Path to the elements.
471     * @param elemlisturlpath URL or the path to the "element-list" file.
472     */
473    private void readElementListFromURL(String urlpath, URL elemlisturlpath)
474            throws Fault {
475        try {
476            URL link = elemlisturlpath.toURI()
477                .resolve(DocPaths.ELEMENT_LIST.getPath()).toURL();
478            try (InputStream in = open(link)) {
479                readElementList(in, urlpath, false, 0, false);
480            }
481        } catch (URISyntaxException | MalformedURLException exc) {
482            throw new Fault(resources.getText("doclet.MalformedURL",
483                elemlisturlpath.toString()), exc);
484        } catch (IOException exc) {
485            readPackageListFromURL(urlpath, elemlisturlpath);
486        }
487    }
488
489    /**
490     * Fetch the URL and read the "package-list" file.
491     *
492     * @param urlpath        Path to the packages.
493     * @param elemlisturlpath URL or the path to the "package-list" file.
494     */
495    private void readPackageListFromURL(String urlpath, URL elemlisturlpath)
496            throws Fault {
497        try {
498            URL link = elemlisturlpath.toURI()
499                .resolve(DocPaths.PACKAGE_LIST.getPath()).toURL();
500            try (InputStream in = open(link)) {
501                readElementList(in, urlpath, false, 0, true);
502            }
503        } catch (URISyntaxException | MalformedURLException exc) {
504            throw new Fault(resources.getText("doclet.MalformedURL",
505                elemlisturlpath.toString()), exc);
506        } catch (IOException exc) {
507            throw new Fault(resources.getText("doclet.URL_error",
508                elemlisturlpath.toString()), exc);
509        }
510    }
511
512    /**
513     * Read the "element-list" file which is available locally.
514     *
515     * @param path URL or directory path to the elements.
516     * @param elemListPath Path to the local "element-list" file.
517     * @throws Fault if an error occurs that can be treated as a warning
518     * @throws DocFileIOException if there is a problem opening the element list file
519     */
520    private void readElementListFromFile(String path, DocFile elemListPath)
521            throws Fault, DocFileIOException {
522        DocFile file = elemListPath.resolve(DocPaths.ELEMENT_LIST);
523        if (!(file.isAbsolute() || linkoffline)) {
524            file = file.resolveAgainst(
525                DocumentationTool.Location.DOCUMENTATION_OUTPUT);
526        }
527        if (file.exists()) {
528            readElementList(file, path, false);
529        } else {
530            DocFile file1 = elemListPath.resolve(DocPaths.PACKAGE_LIST);
531            if (!(file1.isAbsolute() || linkoffline)) {
532                file1 = file1.resolveAgainst(
533                    DocumentationTool.Location.DOCUMENTATION_OUTPUT);
534            }
535            if (file1.exists()) {
536                readElementList(file1, path, true);
537            } else {
538                throw new Fault(
539                    resources.getText("doclet.File_error", file.getPath()),
540                    null);
541            }
542        }
543    }
544
545    private void readElementList(DocFile file, String path,
546            boolean isOldFormDoc) throws Fault, DocFileIOException {
547        try {
548            if (file.canRead()) {
549                boolean pathIsRelative
550                    = !isUrl(path)
551                        && !DocFile.createFileForInput(configuration, path)
552                            .isAbsolute();
553                readElementList(file.openInputStream(), path, pathIsRelative, 0,
554                    isOldFormDoc);
555            } else {
556                throw new Fault(
557                    resources.getText("doclet.File_error", file.getPath()),
558                    null);
559            }
560        } catch (IOException exc) {
561            throw new Fault(
562                resources.getText("doclet.File_error", file.getPath()), exc);
563        }
564    }
565
566    /**
567     * Read the file "element-list" and for each element name found, create
568     * Extern object and associate it with the element name in the map.
569     *
570     * @param input     InputStream from the "element-list" file.
571     * @param path     URL or the directory path to the elements.
572     * @param relative Is path relative?
573     * @param platformVersion The version of platform libraries the element list belongs to,
574     *                        or {@code 0} if it does not belong to a platform libraries doc bundle.
575     * @throws IOException if there is a problem reading or closing the stream
576     */
577    private void readElementList(InputStream input, String path,
578            boolean relative, int platformVersion,
579            boolean isOldFormDoc)
580            throws IOException {
581        try (BufferedReader in
582            = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(input))) {
583            String elemname;
584            DocPath elempath;
585            String moduleName = null;
586            DocPath basePath = DocPath.create(path);
587            boolean showDiagnostic = true;
588            while ((elemname = in.readLine()) != null) {
589                if (elemname.length() > 0) {
590                    elempath = basePath;
591                    if (elemname.startsWith(DocletConstants.MODULE_PREFIX)) {
592                        moduleName = elemname
593                            .replace(DocletConstants.MODULE_PREFIX, "");
594                        Item item = new Item(moduleName, elempath, relative,
595                            isOldFormDoc);
596                        moduleItems.put(moduleName, item);
597                    } else {
598                        DocPath pkgPath
599                            = DocPath.create(elemname.replace('.', '/'));
600                        // Although being modular, JDKs 9 and 10 do not use
601                        // module names in javadoc URL paths.
602                        if (moduleName != null && platformVersion != 9
603                            && platformVersion != 10) {
604                            elempath = elempath.resolve(
605                                DocPath.create(moduleName).resolve(pkgPath));
606                        } else {
607                            elempath = elempath.resolve(pkgPath);
608                        }
609                        String actualModuleName;
610                        // For user provided libraries we check whether
611                        // modularity matches the actual library.
612                        // We trust modularity to be correct for platform
613                        // library element lists.
614                        if (platformVersion == 0) {
615                            actualModuleName = checkLinkCompatibility(elemname,
616                                moduleName, path, showDiagnostic);
617                        } else {
618                            actualModuleName = moduleName == null
619                                ? DocletConstants.DEFAULT_ELEMENT_NAME
620                                : moduleName;
621                        }
622                        Item item = new Item(elemname, elempath, relative,
623                            isOldFormDoc);
624                        packageItems
625                            .computeIfAbsent(actualModuleName,
626                                k -> new TreeMap<>())
627                            .putIfAbsent(elemname, item); // first-one-wins
628                                                          // semantics
629                        showDiagnostic = false;
630                    }
631                }
632            }
633        }
634    }
635
636    /**
637     * Check if the external documentation format matches our internal model of the code.
638     * Returns the module name to use for external reference lookup according to the actual
639     * modularity of the external package (and regardless of modularity of documentation).
640     *
641     * @param packageName the package name
642     * @param moduleName the module name or null
643     * @param path the documentation path
644     * @param showDiagnostic whether to print a diagnostic message in case of modularity mismatch
645     * @return the module name to use according to actual modularity of the package
646     */
647    private String checkLinkCompatibility(String packageName, String moduleName,
648            String path, boolean showDiagnostic) {
649        PackageElement pe = utils.elementUtils.getPackageElement(packageName);
650        if (pe != null) {
651            ModuleElement me = (ModuleElement) pe.getEnclosingElement();
652            if (me == null || me.isUnnamed()) {
653                if (moduleName != null && showDiagnostic) {
654                    printModularityMismatchDiagnostic(
655                        "doclet.linkMismatch_PackagedLinkedtoModule", path);
656                }
657                // library is not modular, ignore module name even if
658                // documentation is modular
659                return DocletConstants.DEFAULT_ELEMENT_NAME;
660            } else if (moduleName == null) {
661                // suppress the diagnostic message in the case of automatic
662                // modules
663                if (!utils.elementUtils.isAutomaticModule(me)
664                    && showDiagnostic) {
665                    printModularityMismatchDiagnostic(
666                        "doclet.linkMismatch_ModuleLinkedtoPackage", path);
667                }
668                // library is modular, use module name for lookup even though
669                // documentation is not
670                return utils.getModuleName(me);
671            }
672        }
673        return moduleName == null ? DocletConstants.DEFAULT_ELEMENT_NAME
674            : moduleName;
675    }
676
677    public boolean isUrl(String urlCandidate) {
678        try {
679            @SuppressWarnings("deprecation")
680            var _unused = new URL(urlCandidate);
681            // No exception was thrown, so this must really be a URL.
682            return true;
683        } catch (MalformedURLException e) {
684            // Since exception is thrown, this must be a directory path.
685            return false;
686        }
687    }
688
689    @SuppressWarnings("deprecation")
690    private URL toURL(String url) throws Fault {
691        try {
692            return new URL(url);
693        } catch (MalformedURLException e) {
694            throw new Fault(resources.getText("doclet.MalformedURL", url), e);
695        }
696    }
697
698    /**
699     * Open a stream to a URL, following a limited number of redirects
700     * if necessary.
701     *
702     * @param url the URL
703     * @return the stream
704     * @throws IOException if an error occurred accessing the URL
705     */
706    private InputStream open(URL url) throws IOException {
707        URLConnection conn = url.openConnection();
708
709        boolean redir;
710        int redirects = 0;
711        InputStream in;
712
713        do {
714            // Open the input stream before getting headers,
715            // because getHeaderField() et al swallow IOExceptions.
716            in = conn.getInputStream();
717            redir = false;
718
719            if (conn instanceof HttpURLConnection http) {
720                int stat = http.getResponseCode();
721                // See:
722                // https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Status
723                // https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_HTTP_status_codes#3xx_Redirection
724                switch (stat) {
725                case 300: // Multiple Choices
726                case 301: // Moved Permanently
727                case 302: // Found (previously Moved Temporarily)
728                case 303: // See Other
729                case 307: // Temporary Redirect
730                case 308: // Permanent Redirect
731                    URL base = http.getURL();
732                    String loc = http.getHeaderField("Location");
733                    URL target = null;
734                    if (loc != null) {
735                        @SuppressWarnings("deprecation")
736                        var _unused = target = new URL(base, loc);
737                    }
738                    http.disconnect();
739                    if (target == null || redirects >= 5) {
740                        throw new IOException("illegal URL redirect");
741                    }
742                    redir = true;
743                    conn = target.openConnection();
744                    redirects++;
745                }
746            }
747        } while (redir);
748
749        if (!url.equals(conn.getURL())) {
750            configuration.getReporter().print(Kind.WARNING,
751                resources.getText("doclet.urlRedirected", url, conn.getURL()));
752        }
753
754        return in;
755    }
756
757    private void printModularityMismatchDiagnostic(String key, Object arg) {
758        switch (configuration.getOptions().linkModularityMismatch()) {
759        case INFO -> configuration.getMessages().notice(key, arg);
760        case WARN -> configuration.getMessages().warning(key, arg);
761        }
762    }
763
764    /**
765     * Converts a name to an old-form HTML name (old-form id).
766     *
767     * @param name the string that needs to be converted to a valid HTML name
768     * @return old-form HTML name
769     */
770    private String getOldFormHtmlName(String name) {
771        /*
772         * The HTML 4 spec at http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/types.html#h-6.2
773         * mentions
774         * that the name/id should begin with a letter followed by other valid
775         * characters.
776         * The HTML 5 spec (draft) is more permissive on names/ids where the
777         * only restriction
778         * is that it should be at least one character long and should not
779         * contain spaces.
780         * The spec draft is @
781         * http://www.w3.org/html/wg/drafts/html/master/dom.html#the-id-
782         * attribute.
783         *
784         * For HTML 4, we need to check for non-characters at the beginning of
785         * the name and
786         * substitute it accordingly, "_" and "$" can appear at the beginning of
787         * a member name.
788         * The method substitutes "$" with "Z:Z:D" and will prefix "_" with
789         * "Z:Z".
790         */
791
792        if (null == name)
793            return name;
794
795        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
796        for (int i = 0; i < name.length(); i++) {
797            char ch = name.charAt(i);
798            switch (ch) {
799            case '(':
800            case ')':
801            case '<':
802            case '>':
803            case ',':
804                sb.append('-');
805                break;
806            case ' ':
807            case '[':
808                break;
809            case ']':
810                sb.append(":A");
811                break;
812            // Any appearance of $ needs to be substituted with ":D" and not
813            // with hyphen
814            // since a field name "P$$ and a method P(), both valid member
815            // names, can end
816            // up as "P--". A member name beginning with $ needs to be
817            // substituted with
818            // "Z:Z:D".
819            case '$':
820                if (i == 0)
821                    sb.append("Z:Z");
822                sb.append(":D");
823                break;
824            // A member name beginning with _ needs to be prefixed with "Z:Z"
825            // since valid anchor
826            // names can only begin with a letter.
827            case '_':
828                if (i == 0)
829                    sb.append("Z:Z");
830                sb.append(ch);
831                break;
832            default:
833                sb.append(ch);
834            }
835        }
836        return sb.toString();
837    }
838}
